Manila gov t to impose 48-hour lockdown on 31 barangays tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-744914 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/metro/744914/manila-gov-t-to-impose-48-hour-lockdown-on-31-barangays/story/ Manila Mayor Isko Moreno on Tuesday placed 31 barangays under a 48-hour hard lockdown for disease surveillance, rapid risk assessment, and testing for the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). Tue, 30 Jun 2020 22:51:24 +0800
Doctors to the barrios summoned to Cebu City concerned with communities they left tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-744913 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/regions/744913/doctors-to-the-barrios-summoned-to-cebu-city-concerned-with-communities-they-left/story/ A physician in the government's Doctors to the Barrio (DTTB) program who was recalled and assigned to Cebu City's COVID-19 frontlines has expressed concern over the rural community he left behind in Argao. Tue, 30 Jun 2020 22:50:15 +0800
China throws support for Philippines war on drugs, tells UN body to stop prejudice tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-744912 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/744912/china-throws-support-for-philippines-war-on-drugs-tells-un-body-to-stop-prejudice/story/ China on Tuesday threw its support for the Philippine government's controversial anti-drug campaign and urged the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC) to stop its "prejudices" on member countries. Tue, 30 Jun 2020 22:30:57 +0800
Angara cries double standard on NTC order halting SkyCable's direct broadcast service tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-744910 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/744910/angara-cries-double-standard-on-ntc-order-halting-skycable-s-direct-broadcast-service/story/ "Grabe double standard dito--'yung iba pinayagan mag-operate habang dinisiyunan ang prangkisa; ito tigok kaagad. 'Di man lang inisip mga tao doon," Angara said in a Twitter post. Tue, 30 Jun 2020 22:26:39 +0800
ABS-CBN willing to review positions that can be regularized, says chief exec tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-744909 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/744909/abs-cbn-willing-to-review-positions-that-can-be-regularized-says-chief-exec/story/ ABS-CBN on Tuesday expressed willingness to review the positions in the broadcast company that can be regularized amid issues being raised on its alleged violation of labor laws. Gaano nga ba kahalaga sa mga tsuper ang muling makapasada? tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-744908 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/ulatfilipino/744908/gaano-nga-ba-kahalaga-sa-mga-tsuper-ang-muling-makapasada/story/ Patuloy pang tinatalakay ng kinauukulang ahensiya ng pamahalaan kung papaano ang magiging proseso kapag pinayagan na muling pumasada ang mga lumang jeepney sa ilalim ng new normal sa panahon ng pandemic. Tue, 30 Jun 2020 22:16:38 +0800
With no signs of survivors, kin of missing fishers getting anxious tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-744906 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/regions/744906/with-no-signs-of-survivors-kin-of-missing-fishers-getting-anxious/story/ As time passed and no signs of survivors were found, the families of fishermen who went missing after their boat collided with a Hong Kong cargo vessel off the coast of Occidental Mindoro on Saturday have become riddled by anxiety."Sana po patuloy na hanapin sila ng Philippine Coast Guard, 'yung kapatid ko na lang po 'yung inaasahan namin ngayon," a relative said. Tue, 30 Jun 2020 22:13:56 +0800
HRW urges UNHRC to launch independent probe into human rights abuses in the Philippines tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-744899 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/744899/hrw-urges-unhrc-to-launch-independent-probe-into-human-rights-abuses-in-the-philippines/story/ International rights organization Human Rights Watch on Tuesday reiterated its call on the United Nations Human Rights Council to create an “independent, impartial and effective” investigation into the drug war killings in the Philippines. Tue, 30 Jun 2020 22:04:56 +0800

SkyCable to stop SkyDirect service on Tuesday night tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-744901 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/744901/skycable-to-stop-skydirect-service-on-tuesday-night/story/ “1.5 million subscribers nationwide, including those in remote areas that do not receive television signals, will be deprived of access to the channels we carry that bring them news, information, education, and entertainment starting tonight June 30, 2020," SkyCable said in a statement. Tue, 30 Jun 2020 21:48:00 +0800
ABS-CBN: Digital transmission using Channel 43 ceases on June 30 evening tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-744898 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/744898/abs-cbn-digital-transmission-using-channel-43-ceases-on-june-30-evening/story/ Media giant ABS-CBN Corp. on Tuesday said it will comply with the National Telecommunications Commission (NTC) order to stop the operations of Channel 43, which it uses to broadcast ABS-CBN TV Plus programs. No Palace signal yet for special session to pass Bayanihan 2 --Sotto tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-744897 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/744897/no-palace-signal-yet-for-special-session-to-pass-bayanihan-2-sotto/story/ The Senate leadership has not received any notice yet if President Rodrigo Duterte will call for a special session to pass a second Bayanihan Law aimed at stimulating economic recovery amid the COVID-19 pandemic, according to Senate President Vicente Sotto III on Tuesday. Bato expects Duterte to urge death penalty for drug trafficking in 5th SONA tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-744892 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/744892/bato-expects-duterte-to-urge-death-penalty-for-drug-trafficking-in-5th-sona/story/ President Rodrigo Duterte may encourage lawmakers to impose the death penalty for illegal drug traffickers when he lays down his legislative agenda in his upcoming State of the Nation Address (SONA), according to his ally Senator Ronald "Bato" Dela Rosa on Tuesday. Tue, 30 Jun 2020 21:12:33 +0800
Lacson, Bato: Escalation of tension after army men killing must be prevented tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-744894 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/nation/744894/lacson-bato-escalation-of-tension-after-army-men-killing-must-be-prevented/story/ Two senators who rose among the ranks of the Philippine National Police (PNP) on Tuesday said an impartial and thorough investigation should be done on the policemen's fatal shooting of soldiers in Jolo, Sulu and that further misunderstandings on the ground must be prevented. Tue, 30 Jun 2020 21:12:32 +0800
